events.title: Canada shooting: 10 dead including suspect in attack on Tumbler Ridge high school, police say
events.description: More than 25 people are injured, including two with life-threatening injuries, after shooting at secondary school and local residence Latest updates: ‚Äòdevastating‚Äô shooting hits remote town of Tumbler Ridge What we know so far about the Tumbler Ridge shooting Nine people have been killed and dozens injured after an assailant opened fire at a school in western Canada, in one of the deadliest mass shootings in the country‚Äôs history. The suspect was later found dead from what appeared to be a self-inflicted injury. Police found six dead inside the high school in the remote town of Tumbler Ridge in British Columbia, with a further two bodies found at a residence believed to be connected to the incident. Another person died on the way to hospital, the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) said. Continue reading...

events.title: Weather tracker: Spain and Portugal hit by third deadly storm in two weeks
events.description: Storm Marta sweeps Iberian peninsula just days after Storms Kristin and Leonardo brought deadly flooding and major damage Spain and Portugal have endured another storm over the weekend, just days after the deadly flooding and major damage caused by Storm Kristin and Storm Leonardo last week. Storm Marta passed over the Iberian peninsula on Saturday, bringing fresh torrential rain and killing two people. Storm Kristin killed at least five people after it made landfall on 28 January with Storm Leonardo claiming another victim last Wednesday . The outlook for this week is for more rain across Spain, Portugal and France, especially across north-west Portugal, where more than 100mm is possible during the first half of the week. Some of the heaviest of the rain will transfer to southern Italy and western parts of Greece and Turkey later in the week. Continue reading...

events.description: US Vice President JD Vance is on a trip to Armenia and Azerbaijan this week to back up a US-brokered peace process in the South Caucasus region with energy, defense and trade deals.

events.title: ICE chief tells US House agency is 'just getting started'
events.description: Three immigration chiefs appeared before a House committee to defend the Trump administration's mass deportation agenda. ICE chief Todd Lyons said his agents plan to "execute their mission with unwavering resolve."

events.title: Ukraine updates: Europe to set its demands for Russia in peace talks
events.description: The EU's Kaja Kallas signals a tougher EU line on Russia in potential peace negotiations. Meanwhile, the Kremlin says it is ready for dialogue with French President Emmanuel Macron. Follow DW for more.

events.title: Person detained for questioning in Nancy Guthrie's kidnapping, police say
events.description: A person was detained in a traffic stop south of Tucson, Arizona for questioning about the disappearance of 84-year-old Nancy Guthrie, police said. The FBI had earlier released surveillance videos of a masked individual tampering with Guthrie's doorbell camera on the night of her apparent kidnapping.

events.title: 2026 Olympics: √âric Perrot earns silver in 20km individual biathlon
events.description: √âric Perrot won France's third medal at the Milan Cortina Olympics, taking silver in the men's 20km individual biathlon race. Norway's Johan-Olav Botn won gold.

events.title: Venezuelan opposition ally placed under house arrest hours after release
events.description: Juan Pablo Guanipa, a close ally of opposition leader Maria Corina Machado, was placed under house arrest on Tuesday, just hours after being freed from prison, sparking an outcry over ongoing repression of political dissidents in Venezuela.

events.title: EU lawmakers back tougher asylum rules allowing fast-track rejections
events.description: EU lawmakers on Tuesday approved changes to the bloc‚Äôs asylum system that would allow fast-track rejections and the transfer of asylum seekers to countries deemed ‚Äúsafe‚Äù, a move that marks a sharp hardening of European migration policy and has drawn strong criticism from rights groups.

events.title: Colombia's Petro says he survived assassination attempt
events.description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro said Tuesday that he had survived an assassination attempt Monday night while travelling by helicopter.

events.title: Trump administration to repeal legal cornerstone of US climate regulations
events.description: The Trump administration is set to repeal an Obama-era regulation that serves as the basis for combating greenhouse gas emissions in the US, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt announced on Tuesday.

events.title: Olympian admits on live TV to cheating on his girlfriend
events.description: Norwegian Olympian Sturla Holm Laegreid confessed in a live television interview to cheating on his girlfriend, moments after winning a bronze medal.

events.title: Irish man detained for months in 'concentration camp' by ICE
events.description: An Irishman who has been detained by ICE for five months has described the facilities as "like a modern-day concentration camp".

events.title: Have a baby while you still can, France to tell 29-year-olds
events.description: All 29-year-old French citizens are to be encouraged by their government to have babies while they still can.

events.title: William stays quiet over Andrew and Epstein - but it's clear something has shifted
events.description: There was no reaction but we know Prince William and his team at least heard the shout, even if they didn't hear the full question.

events.title: Chinese sea captain pleads not guilty in Hong Kong court to damaging Baltic Sea cables
events.description: A Chinese sea captain of a Hong Kong-flagged vessel has pleaded not guilty to damaging undersea cables in the Baltic Sea in 2023

events.title: The mayor of Ecuador's largest port arrested on money laundering and tax evasion charges
events.description: Ecuador's Attorney General's office says the mayor of Guayaquil has been arrested on charges of money laundering and tax evasion

events.title: Venezuelan opposition politician placed under house arrest after release from jail, son says
events.description: Juan Pablo Guanipa, an ally of Venezuela's opposition leader Mar√≠a Corina Machado, has been placed under house arrest

events.title: EU lawmakers agree on migration policies easing deportations, drawing criticism
events.description: European lawmakers have approved a new immigration policy allowing nations to deny asylum and deport migrants from countries deemed safe

events.title: French prosecutor searches for victims after a man is accused of abusing 89 minors over 55 years
events.description: French authorities have revealed the identity of a 79-year-old man accused of raping and sexually assaulting 89 minors over five decades

events.title: Passenger plane in Somalia overshoots the runway into shallow seawater near the airport
events.description: A passenger aircraft carrying 55 people veered off the runway at Somalia‚Äôs main airport and ended up on in shallow water at a nearby beach

events.title: EU drafts a list of concessions it says Russia must make to secure real peace in Ukraine
events.description: The European Union is drafting a list of concessions it believes Russia must make for long-term peace to be achieved in Ukraine

events.title: Women and girls in science: Dismantling barriers, closing gender gaps
events.description: Although women are more likely than young men to pursue higher education, they make up only 35 per cent of science graduates.

events.title: In Bahrain; work, dignity and the quiet rise of home-grown enterprise
events.description: From a crochet hook in a Cairo living room to digital marketplaces reaching across borders, women entrepreneurs are demonstrating how creativity, persistence and targeted support can translate into livelihoods ‚Äî even when formal employment is out of reach.

events.title: DR Congo: UN vows orderly peacekeeping transition as South Africa withdraws troops
events.description: South Africa has moved to withdraw its peacekeepers deployed at the United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (MONUSCO) after nearly three decades of service.

events.title: New FBI video in Nancy Guthrie hunt shows jawline, gait details expert says shouldn‚Äôt be ignored
events.description: A body language expert analyzed a newly released FBI video in the Nancy Guthrie case, revealing key physical clues about the masked subject despite a concealed identity.

events.title: Second alleged Guthrie ransom deadline missed, sparking new theories from Bongino, former FBI agent and doctor
events.description: Nancy Guthrie disappearance enters ninth day as experts question alleged $6 million Bitcoin ransom demands and kidnapping theory validity in ongoing case.

events.title: Ohio man found dead inside trash compactor at pharmacy after wife tracks his location
events.description: Ohio father of two Andrew Strand found dead in CVS trash compactor after his wife tracked his phone when he didn't return home from a contractor job.

events.title: Nicaragua blocks pathway used by Cuban migrants to reach the US
events.description: Nicaragua blocks Cuban citizens from entering without visas, eliminating a key migration route to the U.S. border through Central America and Mexico.

events.title: UK public health system posts job ad for nurse focused on 'close-relative marriage'
events.description: UK health agency advertises nursing role for families in cousin marriages linked to higher genetic risks for children in controversial health program.

events.title: Venezuelan opposition leader seized by armed men after being released from jail
events.description: Mar√≠a Corina Machado said Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Pablo Guanipa was seized by armed men in Caracas after his release from prison.

events.title: Japan's 'Iron Lady' thanks Trump as party secures historic supermajority
events.description: Japan's Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi wins historic supermajority in snap election, earning Trump's praise for her "landslide victory" and conservative agenda.

events.title: Keir Starmer‚Äôs chief of staff resigns after recommending Epstein-connected ambassador
events.description: Morgan McSweeney resigns as Starmer's chief of staff amid criticism over Peter Mandelson's UK ambassador appointment linked to Jeffrey Epstein connections.

events.title: Trump's special envoy Witkoff and Kushner visit US aircraft carrier amid Iran tensions, talks
events.description: Trump envoy Witkoff and Jared Kushner visited the USS Abraham Lincoln amid Iran tensions as Netanyahu prepares a Washington meeting to discuss limiting Tehran's ballistic missiles.
